message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY 

This paper proposes a novel procedure to learn a mapping from short episodes of user activity on social media to a vector space in which the distance between points captures the similarity of the corresponding users' invariant features. The paper focuses on social media users' behavior and proposes a machine learning approach to learn invariant representations of users. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper uses natural language processing techniques to analyze social media content, which makes it relevant to cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also proposes a surrogate metric learning objective, which is a machine learning technique, making it relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed approach using data from Reddit, Twitter, and Wikipedia, which makes it relevant to cs.CY (Computers and Society).
